Chenxiao Yang

Biography

Hi, this is Chenxiao Yang. I am a second-year M.S. student in Computer Science at Shanghai Jiao Tong University advised by Prof. Junchi Yan. I also work closely with David Wipf and Qitian Wu. Before that I obtained my B.S. degree in CS from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. I also worked as research intern at Tencent PEG (Shenzhen), Alibaba DAMO Academy (U.S.) and Amazon AI Lab (Shanghai).

My research is centered around the intersections of machine learning, data mining and graph learning. Particularly, I am excited about developing principles for learning on data with complex structures (such as graph, sequence, tabular data, point cloud), and theoretically understanding relational inductive biases of various machine learning algorithms and deep neural architectures. Moreover, I am also broadly interested in interdisciplinary real-world applications and other topics in machine learning.

Recently, I am looking for PhD opportunities starting from 2024 Fall with the focus on ML. Please feel free to contact me for more information! (CV)
